intro: Eschweilera longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-armed velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous small, winged seeds. Eschweilera longipedicellata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and riverbanks.
